Subjective: Stress-related symptoms; Muscle stiffness; Heart palpitations, regular but faster; Rapid breathing; No chest pain; No dizziness or light-headedness; Difficulty falling asleep, 6 hours of sleep per night; Symptoms worsen during relaxation; No smoking or alcohol mentioned; Request: Rule out physical causes, discuss with professional
Objective: BP 120/60, HR 65, RR 14, SpO2 98%; Lungs clear, no abnormal sounds; Heart sounds normal, no murmurs; No abdominal complaints
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms, likely due to work-related stress; No signs of somatic causes found on physical examination
Plan: 1. Blood test to rule out anaemia, thyroid, liver, and kidney issues. 2. Appointment with mental health nurse. 3. Build moments of relaxation into daily life. 4. Consider consulting occupational health doctor for work adjustments. 5. Follow-up if symptoms worsen or concerns arise.
